text: Iga Zinunula is a Ugandan poet"'Love fetches water', a Painted Voices poem by Iga Zinunula", doenculture.com. Retrieved 22 November 2014. and Veterinary Assistant."BOOKS THEY READ: Samuel Iga Zinunula" monitor.co.ug. Retrieved 22 November 2014. He has engaged in rural development work all over Uganda since 1990. He is a member of the editorial board of FEMRITE."Sam Iga", transculturalwriting.com. Retrieved 20 November 2014. He has been a judge at the Babishai Niwe (BN) Poetry Foundation.2010 Ugandan Women Poetry Award", sienaanstis.wordpress.com. Retrieved 22 November 2014. ==Early life and education== Iga studied agriculture at Makerere University, majoring in livestock sciences. ==Writing== His poetry has been published in newspapers in Uganda, in Makerere University’s literary journal, Dhana, in the Uganda Poetry Anthology 2000 and in Painted Voices. His poem "Africa In Pain" has been used alongside work by renowned poets such as Susan Kiguli and Timothy Wangusa in profiling Ugandan literature. ==Published works== ===Poems=== *"Talking donkeys", "Mbwa gwe osaaza", in *"My brother Abu" in *"Age holds you down", "Love fetches water" in *"Africa in pain", in == References == == External links == *"Uganda: A Community's Effort to Get Safe Clean Water" Category:Living people Category:20th-century Ugandan poets Category:Makerere University alumni Category:Kumusha Category:21st-century Ugandan poets Category:Ugandan male poets Category:20th-century male writers Category:21st- century male writers Category:Year of birth missing (living people)
title: Samuel Iga Zinunula
